item.title: Rory add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "The only reason we don't open our hearts and minds to other people is that they trigger confusion in us that we don't feel brave enough or sane enough to deal with. To the degree that we look clearly and compassionately at ourselves, we feel confident and fearless about looking into someone else's eyes. " -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Rory add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There isn't a way things should be. There's just what happens, and what we do." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Rory add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Rory add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Rory add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "We're all travelling heavy with illusions." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Rory add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Let us forget with generosity those who cannot love us" -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Rory add a quote by Pema Chödrön
item.description: "As human beings, not only do we seek resolution, but we also feel that we deserve resolution. However, not only do we not deserve resolution, we suffer from resolution. We don't deserve resolution; we deserve something better than that. We deserve our birthright, which is the middle way, an open state of mind that can relax with paradox and ambiguity." -- Pema Chödrön

item.title: Rory add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "Science is like sex: sometimes something useful comes out, but that is not the reason we are doing it. " -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: Rory add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Yes, the long war on Christianity. I pray that one day we may live in an America where Christians can worship freely! In broad daylight! Openly wearing the symbols of their religion... perhaps around their necks? And maybe -- dare I dream it? -- maybe one day there can be an openly Christian President. Or, perhaps, 43 of them. Consecutively." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Rory add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "I sit on a man's back choking him and making him carry me, and yet assure myself and others that i am sorry for him and wish to lighten his load by all means possible....except by getting off his back." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Rory add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Blessings be on this house," Granny said, perfunctorily. It was always a good opening remark for a witch. It concentrated people's minds on what other things might be on this house." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Rory add a quote by Neil deGrasse Tyson
item.description: "Recognize that the very molecules that make up your body, the atoms that construct the molecules, are traceable to the crucibles that were once the centers of high mass stars that exploded their chemically rich guts into the galaxy, enriching pristine gas clouds with the chemistry of life. So that we are all connected to each other biologically, to the earth chemically and to the rest of the universe atomically. That’s kinda cool! That makes me smile and I actually feel quite large at the end of that. It’s not that we are better than the universe, we are part of the universe. We are in the universe and the universe is in us." -- Neil deGrasse Tyson

item.title: Rory add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go. For holding on comes easily; we do not need to learn it." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Rory add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The point of marriage is not to create a quick commonality by tearing down all boundaries; on the contrary, a good marriage is one in which each partner appoints the other to be the guardian of his solitude, and thus they show each other the greatest possible trust. A merging of two people is an impossibility, and where it seems to exist, it is a hemming-in, a mutual consent that robs one party or both parties of their fullest freedom and development. But once the realization is accepted that even between the closest people infinite distances exist, a marvelous living side-by-side can grow up for them, if they succeed in loving the expanse between them, which gives them the possibility of always seeing each other as a whole and before an immense sky." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Rory add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Let everything happen to you Beauty and terror Just keep going No feeling is final" -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Rory add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The necessary thing is after all but this; solitude, great inner solitude. Going into oneself for hours meeting no one - this one must be able to attain." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Rory add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "I tell you this to break your heart, by which I mean only that it break open and never close again to the rest of the world." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Rory add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Rory add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Rory add a quote by Daphne Rae
item.description: "I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love." -- Daphne Rae

item.title: Rory add a quote by Pema Chödrön
item.description: "…feelings like disappointment, embarrassment, irritation, resentment, anger, jealousy, and fear, instead of being bad news, are actually very clear moments that teach us where it is that we’re holding back. They teach us to perk up and lean in when we feel we’d rather collapse and back away. They’re like messengers that show us, with terrifying clarity, exactly where we’re stuck. This very moment is the perfect teacher, and, lucky for us, it’s with us wherever we are." -- Pema Chödrön

item.title: Rory add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "We don't set out to save the world; we set out to wonder how other people are doing and to reflect on how our actions affect other people's hearts." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Rory add a quote by Pema Chödrön
item.description: "Rejoicing in ordinary things is not sentimental or trite. It actually takes guts. Each time we drop our complaints and allow everyday good fortune to inspire us, we enter the warrior's world." -- Pema Chödrön

item.title: Rory add a quote by Pema Chödrön
item.description: "Everything is fresh, the essence of realization." -- Pema Chödrön

item.title: Rory add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "The goal of life is to make your heartbeat match the beat of the universe to match your nature with Nature." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Rory add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "We're not on our journey to save the world but to save ourselves. But in doing that you save the world. The influence of a vital person vitalizes." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Rory add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Instead of clearing his own heart the zealot tries to clear the world." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Rory add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Furthermore, we have not even to risk the adventure alone; for the heroes of all time have gone before us, the labyrinth is fully known; we have only to follow the thread of the hero-path. And where we had thought to find an abomination, we shall find a god; where we had thought to slay another, we shall slay ourselves; where we had thought to travel outward, we shall come to the center of our own existence; where we had thought to be alone, we shall be with all the world." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Rory add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Rory add a quote by Michelle Tea
item.description: "Maybe if everyone walked around being in touch with each other's hidden pain it could work out and even be beautiful, but it doesn't feel safe to be the only compassionate person on the planet." -- Michelle Tea
